Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Delhi police files FIR against Rahul Gandhi, removes 'attempt to murder' charge - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Police Files FIR Against Rahul Gandhi Amid Winter Session Turmoil

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Winter Session of Parliament is nearing its end amid escalating tensions, particularly surrounding Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks about Dr. BR Ambedkar. This includes a recently filed FIR against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, where the serious charge of 'attempt to murder' has been removed.

  • High tension in Parliament with opposition MPs protesting Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar.
  • Rahul Gandhi accused of pushing a BJP MP, Pratap Sarangi, during the protest, leading to injuries.
  • JPC on 'One Nation, One Election' bills may be formally initiated; committee members include leaders from major parties.
  • Nationwide protests planned by Congress against Amit Shah's remarks, calling for his resignation and apology.
“BJP MPs blocked our path and instigated the violence,” claimed Rahul Gandhi during a press briefing.

In conclusion, the political landscape in India remains turbulent with ongoing protests and significant allegations, casting a shadow over the Winter Session of Parliament.
newTitle: Delhi Police Files FIR Against Rahul Gandhi Amid Winter Session Turmoil

title: Proud parents Abhishek Bachchan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and grandfather Amitabh Bachchan beam with pride - TOI Etimes
summary:
Aaradhya Bachchan Shines in Christmas Play

Publication Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Aaradhya Bachchan, daughter of Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan, showcased her talent during a Christmas play at her school, leaving the audience captivated.

  • Aaradhya performed on December 19, thrilling attendees with her role in the Christmas play.
  • She wore a striking red robe, complete with a cream-toned scarf and a pearl choker.
  • Her performance included graceful dialogue delivery and charming presence, garnering admiration.
  • Aaradhya performed alongside AbRam, reminiscent of her parents' iconic film moments.
  • The event demonstrated the love and support of her parents, Abhishek and Aishwarya, as well as her grandfather, Amitabh Bachchan.
The couple’s camaraderie shone through as they held hands, with Abhishek sweetly guiding Aishwarya and even adjusting her dupatta during the event.

This event highlighted the family's bond and put rumors about Aishwarya and Abhishek's marital life to rest, showcasing their unity and respect for one another.
newTitle: Aaradhya Bachchan Shines in Christmas Play, Parents and Grandfather Proud

summary:
Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in ’every town, city, tehsil’

  • Ola Electric anticipates reaching 4,000 stores by Christmas.
  • Customers can save around ₹4,000 per month by using Ola's electric vehicles.
  • New electric bike models were released on Independence Day in 2024: Roadster Pro, Roadster, and Roadster X.
  • Ola aims to integrate its own batteries into vehicles starting in the first quarter of the next financial year.
  • Ola's first electric scooter, the S1 Pro, was delivered in December 2021.
“With EVs, you will save ₹4,000 per month. Your savings will increase, and you'll save money with this savings wala scooter,” - Bhavish Aggarwal

Ola Electric’s expansion plans reflect its commitment to increasing accessibility to electric vehicles across various regions.

title: Justin Trudeau's Crisis Deepens As More Liberal MPs Call For His Resignation. What's His Next Move? - News18
summary:
Justin Trudeau's Crisis Deepens As More Liberal MPs Call For His Resignation. What's His Next Move?

Publication Date: December 19, 2024, Source: News18

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is facing increasing pressure to resign as multiple Liberal MPs publicly call for his departure following the surprise resignation of Deputy PM Chrystia Freeland.

  • Approximately 15 Liberal MPs, including Brendan Hanley and Jenica Atwin, have requested Trudeau to step down to allow new leadership.
  • Freeland's resignation has sparked a revolt within Trudeau's party, threatening his leadership.
  • Trudeau suffered significant losses in a recent by-election, exacerbating his unpopularity and internal dissent.
  • Trudeau’s close ally acknowledged the need for reflection on these leadership complaints.
  • Future leadership uncertainty is raising concerns about the stability of the Liberal Party.
“This isn’t just about one man — it’s about saving our party from historic defeat.” - Wayne Long

Trudeau's current situation presents a critical juncture for the Liberal Party, raising questions about who might succeed him should he resign.
newTitle: Justin Trudeau Faces Calls for Resignation Amid Party Turmoil

title: China built significant military infrastructure since 2020 standoff with India: U.S. report - The Hindu
summary:
China built significant military infrastructure since 2020 standoff with India: U.S. report

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The U.S. report highlights an increased military presence and infrastructure development by the People's Liberation Army (PLA) along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) since the 2020 standoff with India, emphasizing China's preparations for potential conflicts.

  • PLA's coercive actions have escalated in the Indo-Pacific region during 2023.
  • Significant military infrastructure has been built since the 2020 standoff with India.
  • China has not reduced its troop levels or military positions since the Galwan clash in June 2020.
  • In November 2023, India and China agreed to disengage from two remaining friction points.
  • Since 1998, China has settled several territorial disputes with its neighbors using a more assertive strategy.
The PLA has not drawn down its positions or troop numbers since the 2020 clash and has built infrastructure and support facilities to maintain multiple Brigade deployments along the LAC.

This report underscores a continuous military buildup and prepares the world for potential further tensions in the region.
newTitle: China's Military Buildup Along the India Border Since 2020: Key Findings from U.S. Report

title: BJP MLC CT Ravi arrested for ‘offensive language’ against Karnataka minister Laxmi Hebbalkar - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP MLC CT Ravi Arrested for Offensive Remarks Against Karnataka Minister

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka BJP MLC C T Ravi was arrested following complaints of using derogatory language against minister Laxmi Hebbalkar during a legislative meeting.

  • C T Ravi was charged under sections related to sexual harassment and insulting the modesty of a woman.
  • The incident occurred on the last day of the Karnataka legislative council's winter session.
  • Ravi denied the allegations, labeling his arrest as politically motivated.
“Her allegations are false, let the audio and videos get verified.” - C T Ravi

The incident has sparked protests and raised discussions about decorum in legislative sessions.
newTitle: BJP MLC CT Ravi Arrested for Offensive Remarks Against Karnataka Minister

title: IIM CAT Result 2024 released, 14 students score 100 percentile: Direct link - India Today
summary:
IIM CAT Result 2024 Released: 14 Students Achieve 100 Percentile

Published On: Dec 19, 2024

Source: India Today

The much-anticipated IIM CAT Result 2024 has been declared by IIM Calcutta, revealing that 14 students have achieved perfect scores. Candidates can check their scores on the official website, iimcat.ac.in.

  • Out of 3.29 lakh registered candidates, 2.93 lakh appeared for the exam.
  • Among the 14 perfect scorers, 13 were engineers and 13 were males.
  • A total of 29 candidates scored 99.99 percentile; 25 of them were engineers.
  • The official website emphasizes its authenticity for CAT information.
“Please be aware that this is the only authentic website for CAT 2024.”

With results announced, candidates are advised to check for updates on cut-off scores and merit lists on the official website.

On Ravichandran Ashwin's Successor In Team India, Sunil Gavaskar's Massive "Ahead Of Him" Verdict For Youngster - NDTV Sports
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Weighs In on Ashwin's Successor in Team India

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin's sudden retirement has left a significant void for the Indian cricket team. With the upcoming Boxing Day Test against Australia, discussions around his potential successor have intensified, particularly focusing on Washington Sundar.

  • Ashwin was the world's highest active wicket-taker with 537 wickets.
  • Sunil Gavaskar commented on Ashwin's untimely retirement and the team's adjustments moving forward.
  • Gavaskar hinted that Washington Sundar might be favored as Ashwin's successor.
“Maybe Washington Sundar is ahead of him. Rohit mentioned that he is flying out tomorrow. So, this marks the end of Ashwin as an international cricketer.” – Sunil Gavaskar

The Indian cricket team will face challenges as they adapt to Ashwin's absence, which may have significant implications for the upcoming series.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Weighs In on Ashwin's Successor in Team India

summary:
Mumbai ferry accident: Missing body recovered, death toll rises to 14

In Mumbai, the ongoing recovery efforts have led to the discovery of another body from the tragic ferry accident, increasing the confirmed death toll to 14. Rescue operations continue as authorities seek to recover any remaining victims.

  • The accident involved a ferry that capsized in Mumbai waters.
  • Search operations have been conducted by local authorities, including divers and rescue teams.
  • Safety regulations and ferry operations have come under scrutiny following the incident.
“We will continue our efforts until every victim is accounted for.” - Local Official

title: Women Need To Realise That Beneficial Laws Aren't Means To Threaten, Domineer Or Extort From Their... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Warns Against Misuse of Domestic Violence Laws by Wives

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Law

In a recent ruling, the Supreme Court cautioned women against misusing domestic violence and dowry laws, which are intended for their protection. The Court reiterated that these laws are being exploited for personal gain in matrimonial disputes.

  • The Court highlighted an alarming trend of invoking various sections of the Indian Penal Code, such as 498A and 376, as a collective strategy to pressure husbands.
  • Justices BV Nagarathna and NK Singh noted that these provisions should not be used for intimidation or extortion.
  • Minor disputes can escalate due to the misuse, leading to irreconcilable relationships.
  • The Court emphasized that criminal complaints should not serve as negotiation tools for monetary demands.
“The women need to be careful about the fact that these strict provisions of law in their hands are beneficial legislations for their welfare and not means to chastise, threaten, domineer or extort from their husbands.”

Ultimately, the Supreme Court urged for a careful and fair application of these laws to ensure they serve their intended purpose without exploitation.
newTitle: Supreme Court Warns Against Misuse of Domestic Violence Laws by Wives

120-Foot Asteroid 2024 XN1 to Safely Pass Earth on Christmas Eve: NASA - The Hans India
summary:
Asteroid 2024 XN1 to Safely Pass Earth on Christmas Eve

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NASA

An asteroid named 2024 XN1, approximately 120 feet in size, is set to pass by Earth at a safe distance on Christmas Eve, December 24. NASA confirms there is no danger to our planet.

This asteroid will approach Earth at about 4,480,000 miles away, traveling at 14,743 miles per hour. Its safe passage highlights the importance of monitoring near-Earth objects.

  • Asteroid 2024 XN1 is classified as a near-Earth object (NEO).
  • The asteroid will pass at a distance more than 16 times that of the Moon.
  • NASA uses advanced technology and radar systems to track asteroids.
  • The flyby emphasizes the need for ongoing monitoring and planetary defense.
“While asteroid 2024 XN1 poses no immediate threat, its flyby underscores the necessity of ongoing asteroid monitoring.”

In conclusion, the approach of asteroid 2024 XN1 serves as a reminder of the continued need for tracking near-Earth objects to safeguard our planet.
newTitle: Asteroid 2024 XN1 to Safely Pass Earth on Christmas Eve

title: Mayawati says Ambedkar's dignity hurt, Amit Shah must take back 'these words' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mayawati Condemns Amit Shah's Comments on Ambedkar

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a press conference, BSP chief Mayawati criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah for remarks made in the Rajya Sabha that she claims hurt the dignity of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, the architect of the Indian Constitution. She demanded Shah retract his statement and repent for the anger it has caused among Ambedkar's followers.

  • Mayawati stated that Shah's comments insulted Ambedkar and deeply affected his dignity.
  • She emphasized that there is widespread anger against Shah for his remarks.
  • Shah's comments were made during a debate on the Constitution, suggesting the Congress party exploits Ambedkar's name.
  • Shah claimed that if Congress had invoked God's name as often as Ambedkar, they would attain heaven.
“The words used by Amit Shah in the Parliament about the architect of the Indian Constitution and messiah of Dalits and other neglected classes... have greatly hurt Baba Saheb's dignity.” - Mayawati

This incident has sparked protests from various political parties and is indicative of the ongoing tensions regarding the representation and respect of Dalit icons in Indian politics.
newTitle: Mayawati Condemns Amit Shah's Comments on Ambedkar

title: ‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has entered the 24th day of his fast-unto-death, pressing the government for a legal guarantee of minimum support price (MSP) for crops. His health has deteriorated significantly, and he is now in a critical condition, at risk of cardiac arrest.

Key Points:

  • Dallewal, 70, has not eaten for 24 days as part of his protest.
  • Doctors report that his health is critical, with risks of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure.
  • The Supreme Court has criticized the Punjab government for failing to conduct timely health tests on Dallewal.
“His life is hanging by a thread.” - Doctors attending Dallewal

The situation is becoming increasingly urgent as his health continues to decline.
newTitle: Critical Condition of Farmer Leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal Amid Ongoing Fast

title: ‘Mukesh Rajput’s BP still high, Pratap Sarangi a cardiac patient': Doctors on injured BJP MPs - Hindustan Times
summary:
Injured BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi Hospitalized Following Parliament Scuffle

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Two BJP MPs, Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi, were admitted to RML Hospital due to injuries sustained during a scuffle outside Parliament. Doctors reported that both MPs had head injuries and were being monitored for blood pressure-related issues.

  • Both MPs admitted to RML Hospital following injuries from an altercation.
  • Doctors stated that both sustained head injuries and have high blood pressure concerns.
  • Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited the MPs and reported that they would remain in the hospital for observation.
  • Ajay Shukla, the Medical Superintendent, provided updates on their conditions.
  • The incident has sparked political tensions, with BJP and Congress filing complaints against each other.
“Rajput ji's blood pressure is still high. We are doing our best possible.” – Dr. Ajay Shukla

The condition of the MPs requires careful observation following a violent confrontation that underscores ongoing political tensions.
newTitle: Injured BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi Hospitalized Following Parliament Scuffle

title: ‘We share same fight’: Gisèle Pelicot's first reaction after mass-rape judgment - Hindustan Times
summary:
'We share same fight': Gisèle Pelicot's First Reaction After Mass-Rape Judgment

Date & Source: Dec 19, 2024 08:18 PM IST - HT News Desk

Introduction: A French court found Dominique Pelicot, Gisèle Pelicot's ex-husband, guilty of repeatedly drugging and raping his wife for almost a decade. The verdict was a landmark judgement that has horrified the world.

  • Gisèle Pelicot's first remark after the judgement was 'We share the same fight.'
  • Pelicot expressed support for other victims of sexual violence.
  • Dominique Pelicot was sentenced to 20 years in prison.
  • All 50 co-defendants were found guilty of rape or related charges.
I respect the court and the decision of its verdict. I never regretted opening the trial to the public and was now thinking of the unrecognised victims whose stories often remain in the shadows.

Conclusion: Gisèle Pelicot's courage and determination during the trial have made her a symbol of feminist strength. The case highlights the importance of seeking justice for victims of sexual violence.
newTitle: 'We share same fight': Gisèle Pelicot's First Reaction After Mass-Rape Judgment

title: Updated World Magnetic Model Predicts Magnetic North Pole’s Shift - Gadgets 360
summary:
Magnetic North Pole shift triggers new World Magnetic Model

Date: December 17, 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

The National Centers for Environmental Information and the British Geological Survey have released an updated version of the World Magnetic Model to enhance navigational accuracy due to shifts in the magnetic North Pole.

  • The updated WMM forecasts changes in Earth's magnetic field over the next five years.
  • It is critical for maintaining the reliability of navigational systems, including satellite and smartphone navigation.
  • The magnetic North Pole is moving due to fluid dynamics in Earth's outer core.
  • The update integrates data from the European Space Agency's Swarm mission.
“The model allows navigation tools to provide reliable directions by accounting for fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field.” - William Brown, BGS

This updated model is expected to sustain navigational reliability, ensuring accuracy without noticeable changes for most users.
newTitle: Magnetic North Pole Shift Leads to Updated World Magnetic Model

summary:

Mohammad Amir discussed the potential hybrid model for the ICC Champions Trophy, emphasizing that even if a match between India and Pakistan were to take place on the moon, the excitement and rivalry would remain unmatched.

  • Amir highlights the significance of India vs Pakistan matchups in cricket.
  • He supports the idea of a hybrid model for international tournaments.
  • Amir suggests that cricket's popularity transcends geographical boundaries, capturing global interest.
“Even if India vs Pakistan happens on the moon, the rivalry will always be exciting!”

Amir’s comments reflect the deep-rooted passion and competition in cricket, specifically between these two nations.
